docs.lead_paragraph: The agency is frowning on a plan that promises that the insurance contribution a company makes to its employees’ coverage is tax-free for the employees and excluded from payroll taxes for the employer.

headline.main: Risking a Health Insurance Strategy the I.R.S. May Not Approve
headline.print_headline: Risking a Health Insurance Strategy the I.R.S. May Not Approve

docs.abstract: You're the Boss blog; Zane Benefits offers businesses an online insurance claims reimbursement service and allows them to create defined contribution health plans that may run afoul of guidelines issued by Internal Revenue Service; Zane Benefits president Rick Lindquist says plan does not violate any rules, even though IRS has warned about health reimbursement arrangements.
docs.snippet: The agency is frowning on a plan that promises that the insurance contribution a company makes to its employees’ coverage is tax-free for the employees and excluded from payroll taxes for the employer.

headline.main: Can the Minimum Wage Be Too High?

docs.abstract: On Monday Seattle raised its minimum wage to $15 an hour. But can the city afford it? Will it lead to job losses, as some predict, or be a model for national reform?
docs.snippet: On Monday Seattle raised its minimum wage to $15 an hour. But can the city afford it? Will it lead to job losses, as some predict, or be a model for national reform?

docs.lead_paragraph: About 2.2 million people, or more than one in every four Americans who signed up for private health coverage under President Barack Obama's healthcare reform law, have inconsistent data in their applications that could lead to them losing coverage in isolated cases, officials said on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Six million people have enrolled in government healthcare programs for the poor, including Medicaid, since the launch of Obamacare health insurance enrollment on Oct. 1, the Obama administration said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Medicaid Logs 6 Million New Enrollees Since Obamacare Rollout

headline.main: Would You Try This Health Insurance Strategy With Your Company?

docs.abstract: A number of companies are offering plans that effectively allow companies to reimburse employees for the individual insurance they buy. The problem is that the Internal Revenue Service may not approve — and the penalties could be big.
docs.snippet: A number of companies are offering plans that effectively allow companies to reimburse employees for the individual insurance they buy. The problem is that the Internal Revenue Service may not approve — and the penalties could be big.

docs.lead_paragraph: UnitedHealth is once again hiking the quarterly dividend it gives shareholders by more than 30 percent, with the latest increase tripling the initial value of a payout the nation's largest health insurer debuted in 2010.

headline.main: Insurer UnitedHealth Raises Dividend by 34 Pct

docs.lead_paragraph: Voters in California's Alameda County passed a measure on Tuesday that is expected to raise $100 million a year for health clinics for illegal immigrants, who are excluded from state programs and the federal Affordable Care Act, or Obamacare.

headline.main: Californian County Votes in Health Services Measure for Illegal Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Californian County Votes in Health Services Measure for Illegal Immigrants

docs.lead_paragraph: House Republicans are united as ever in their election-year opposition to "Obamacare," but they're increasingly divided over their promise to vote this year on an alternative to it.

docs.lead_paragraph: A wealthy insurance executive beat a perennial conservative candidate in the Republican primary in New Jersey’s Third Congressional District on Tuesday.

headline.main: In New Jersey, a Republican Nominee Will Try to Hold On to a Congressional Seat
headline.print_headline: In New Jersey, a Republican Nominee Will Try to Hold On to a Congressional Seat

docs.abstract: Republican Tom MacArthur defeats Steve Lonegan in GOP primary in New Jersey's Third Congressional District; he faces Aimee Belgard in election, who handily won Democratic primary; Democrats are hoping to turn district, where Republican John Runyan is retiring.
docs.snippet: A wealthy insurance executive beat a perennial conservative candidate in the Republican primary in New Jersey’s Third Congressional District on Tuesday.
